004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N2;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
011
012/**
013 * Filters the provided voltages to limit a differential drive's linear and angular acceleration.
014 *
015 * <p>The differential drive model can be created via the functions in {@link
016 * edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId}.
017 */
018public class DifferentialDriveAccelerationLimiter {
019  private final LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> m_system;
020  private final double m_trackwidth;
021  private final double m_maxLinearAccel;
022  private final double m_maxAngularAccel;
023
024  /**
025   * Constructs a DifferentialDriveAccelerationLimiter.
026   *
027   * @param system The differential drive dynamics.
028   * @param trackwidth The distance between the differential drive's left and right wheels in
029   *     meters.
030   * @param maxLinearAccel The maximum linear acceleration in meters per second squared.
031   * @param maxAngularAccel The maximum angular acceleration in radians per second squared.
032   */
033  public DifferentialDriveAccelerationLimiter(
034      LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> system,
035      double trackwidth,
036      double maxLinearAccel,
037      double maxAngularAccel) {
038    m_system = system;
039    m_trackwidth = trackwidth;
040    m_maxLinearAccel = maxLinearAccel;
041    m_maxAngularAccel = maxAngularAccel;
042  }
043
044  /**
045   * Returns the next voltage pair subject to acceleraiton constraints.
046   *
047   * @param leftVelocity The left wheel velocity in meters per second.
048   * @param rightVelocity The right wheel velocity in meters per second.
049   * @param leftVoltage The unconstrained left motor voltage.
050   * @param rightVoltage The unconstrained right motor voltage.
051   * @return The constrained wheel voltages.
052   */
053  public DifferentialDriveWheelVoltages calculate(
054      double leftVelocity, double rightVelocity, double leftVoltage, double rightVoltage) {
055    var u = new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N1()).fill(leftVoltage, rightVoltage);
056
057    // Find unconstrained wheel accelerations
058    var x = new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N1()).fill(leftVelocity, rightVelocity);
059    var dxdt = m_system.getA().times(x).plus(m_system.getB().times(u));
060
061    // Convert from wheel accelerations to linear and angular accelerations
062    //
063    // a = (dxdt(0) + dx/dt(1)) / 2
064    //   = 0.5 dxdt(0) + 0.5 dxdt(1)
065    //
066    // α = (dxdt(1) - dxdt(0)) / trackwidth
067    //   = -1/trackwidth dxdt(0) + 1/trackwidth dxdt(1)
068    //
069    // [a] = [          0.5           0.5][dxdt(0)]
070    // [α]   [-1/trackwidth  1/trackwidth][dxdt(1)]
071    //
072    // accels = M dxdt where M = [0.5, 0.5; -1/trackwidth, 1/trackwidth]
073    var M =
074        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2())
075            .fill(0.5, 0.5, -1.0 / m_trackwidth, 1.0 / m_trackwidth);
076    var accels = M.times(dxdt);
077
078    // Constrain the linear and angular accelerations
079    if (accels.get(0, 0) > m_maxLinearAccel) {
080      accels.set(0, 0, m_maxLinearAccel);
081    } else if (accels.get(0, 0) < -m_maxLinearAccel) {
082      accels.set(0, 0, -m_maxLinearAccel);
083    }
084    if (accels.get(1, 0) > m_maxAngularAccel) {
085      accels.set(1, 0, m_maxAngularAccel);
086    } else if (accels.get(1, 0) < -m_maxAngularAccel) {
087      accels.set(1, 0, -m_maxAngularAccel);
088    }
089
090    // Convert the constrained linear and angular accelerations back to wheel
091    // accelerations
092    dxdt = M.solve(accels);
093
094    // Find voltages for the given wheel accelerations
095    //
096    // dx/dt = Ax + Bu
097    // u = B⁻¹(dx/dt - Ax)
098    u = m_system.getB().solve(dxdt.minus(m_system.getA().times(x)));
099
100    return new DifferentialDriveWheelVoltages(u.get(0, 0), u.get(1, 0));
101  }
102}
